Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394347) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394347)
